website_summaries.verdict: Long-lasting fishing pliers made from corrosion-resistant stainless steel.
pros: Includes multiple tools and carbide cutters to snip most styles of fishing line
Jaws of the 7" pliers allow you to tightly grab hooks or crimp tackle, locking it in place
Handle has a rubber coating, so you can grip the pliers securely
cons: May not snip some really thick fishing line

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Loved the grips on the handles, the quality and thickness of the pliers, the side mounted cutters and the case. The safety cable is nice, but the carabiner does seem a little on the thin side compared to the quality of the pliers. These are fantastic. We're really glad we purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Mb-amazon

customer_reviews.title: NOT stainless steel as advertised
customer_reviews.text: A week after the first fishing trip to the gulf, these were beginning to rust. Two weeks later and the second fishing trip, these look like pictured. The rust is so bad, that the cutter tool won't even cut fishing line anymore. We always wash the boat and all contents after every fishing trip. What looks like dirt in the grooves of the pliers is actually rust!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri C.

customer_reviews.title: FAKE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE. FAKE REVIEWS Horrible fishing pliers. They are NOT good with saltwater, already rusting and the cutter won’t even cut mono now. They get fake reviews by sending a coupon if you leave a good review BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Go with another brand!!
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy or recommend this product whatsoever. Fishing pliers broke at the hinge in less than a month. Always rinsed thoroughly with freshwater after every use and pliers quickly showed signs of rust and broke easily with very little pressure during a fishing trip. Would not recommend at all! Save your money, buy a cheaper pair that’s just as good quality if not better. Manufacturers would not get back to me regarding replacement either. Definitely better companies out there
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hasler

customer_reviews.title: So smart!
customer_reviews.text: These plyers are very smart. What I mean by that is the line cutter is actually located in an intelligent spot. So many fishing pliers I have seen have the line cutter located in a area that is difficult to use. These are just simply designed better and seem to be well made. I intend to do a review video of them on my YouTube channel MID-SOUTH OUTDOOR LIFE
customer_reviews.author: Quinton Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice pliers work will for cutting and like the case and lanyard attached to the pliers. Came quick no issues
customer_reviews.author: M. Shillingburg

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LIGHT, EASY TO GRIP, EASY TO USE AT A PRICE UNBELIEVABLE PRICE POINT!
customer_reviews.text: *VERY LIGHT *EASY TO MANEUVER DUE ITS EXCELLENT *SIZE IS PERFECT FOR LARGE HANDS * CONTOUR GRIPS *COMFORTABLE GRIPS - ATTRACTIVE COLOR * THEY DO NOT CLOSE, STAY OPEN, SOME MIGHT LIKE OR DISLIKE *HOLSTER IS NICELY MADE *PERFECT FOR KAYAK ANGLERS OR BANK ANGLERS ( I AM ONE)
customer_reviews.author: MRod

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving these pliers. I have paid triple the price for good fishing pliers in the past and I can honestly say that these are better than any I’ve used!!! Finally affordable high quality tackle. I highly recommend! I have several different products from KastKing and all are excellent. You will be amazed whenever you make a first purchase from this Company and see for yourself how good their products are. I sure was.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing works properly. Nose wont secure tightly on hooks. Cutting blades arent square with opposite faces so braid is impossible to cut and the sheath constantly rotates dropping the pliers. But hey, the leash keeps them from going to far....basically dead weight and wasted carbon footprint. Not impressed with QC @kastking. I doubt I'll be buying any reels or rods from Kastking.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Habit

customer_reviews.title: Pliers rust after my first wade...
customer_reviews.text: It developed rust too easily, I take good care of my tools. Rusted after my first wade and bent while extracting the first hook from a fish's mouth.huge disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: kman

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed not worth 20 bucks. Low quality, doesnt cut braid
customer_reviews.text: I have had these on my boat for almost a year and have been disappointed. They never cut braid at all, floro would cut though. And the end of the split ring sorta moves like, with much pressure they slip just very low quality overall with little to no QC. What makes it worse is these reviews you see, im guessing most of these people dont know what actual quality is or got some insane discount or just big fans overall so say anything positive even when its not. I would really not believe these 5 star reviews somethings just not adding up. The good is they look nice, and the lanyard is nice.
customer_reviews.author: William Vest

customer_reviews.title: A must in your gear bag 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome awesome 👏🏻 Best fishing pliers i have ever owned. Cutter on tje side is great and cits braid better than My braid scissors. Good job Kastking The holder is great and the clip is very secure. My only complaint is the holder only has one hole for the lanyard on the left side and I wear them on my left side being left-handed so I get tangled in the lanyard every time I use them. Would be nice if the holder had a whole on both sides for the carabiner clip into other than that these things are awesome
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used them I was simply crimping a crimp sleeve onto a downrigger release clip and the handle collapsed. I hadn't applied even close to the pressure needed to secure a crimp sleeve before the pliers failed. I suspect that if you use these strictly for light duty, clipping line, etc, they should be fine. Just don't expect too much out of them. Full disclosure, I am returning the defective ones for another pair. The belt pouch that comes with them is great (clips on without removing your belt), and if you don't expect too much, these are good light duty pliers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hyde

customer_reviews.title: A step above your typical fishing pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I chose these excellent pliers not only by the great reviews but by the features, ergonomics and the quality of the pliers and the excellent belt sheath/case. The pliers are spring loaded so they are always ready and the side line/hook cutter is a big plus compared to the ones that are located in the center. The case is a big upgrade from the usual cordura sheaths. It is very high quality and the lanyard has two attachment points so that you can dial in the fit.
customer_reviews.author: ascNYC

customer_reviews.title: All around very versatile great tool
customer_reviews.text: The things are great. I use a heavier braid and it cuts it like butter. Also helps when tying knots with the hook hole for superior tightness on my knots. The handle is great especially since my hands are mostly wet all the time. I keep attached to my vest and it’s quickly and easily accessible. Most of all, it’s perfect for the split rings. Would def recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: The L fam

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed two of these, one for me and one for my son. I finally narrowed it down to this one and different one, so I ordered one of each. This is by far my favorite. It fits my hand perfectly, cuts braided and mono line with ease and I really like the fact the sheath on this one because it clips on your belt and the clip swivels. This alone is a big advantage over the other one. Of course I will keep this one and give the other one to my son. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Dull easily
customer_reviews.text: Pliers are comfortable to hold. The cutters were sharp at first, but became very dull by the end of my first offshore fishing trip with them. The cutters also came loose (unscrewed) and I almost lost the pieces. Will need to be secured with locktite. Have to cut mono several times to get to separate. Sheath spins around and doesn’t stay upright. Still better than last pair of pliers I had. (Update) pliers are very rusty after saltwater use and cutters don’t cut mono line without having to repeatedly squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product fair price
customer_reviews.text: I just received my second product (Cutthroat 7” Pliers) from Kastking. These are well designed and well-made pliers. I find the split ring tool to be immensely helpful. I fish with plenty of artificial lures and opening split rings has always been a challenge. Not so with the Kastking pliers. The split rings were opened quickly and effectively. I have not tried the line cutting application yet as I have braid scissors for this application. Overall I rate these pliers 5 stars and will continue to order Kastking products. Tight lines!
customer_reviews.author: EC_Nana

customer_reviews.title: I probably just got a bad pair...:(
customer_reviews.text: This plier worked well for about one week. However, plier can no longer cutting line, not even mono line after few times using. I probably just got a bad pair...:(
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Multi-function and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Love my Kastking Cuththoat Pliers. They are a perfect size. Grips have a great coating dry and wet. They are sturdy, make clean line cuts and crimps. Appreciate they come with a durable well made lanyard and a clip-on pouch that is rigid and form-fitting, not flimsy piece of fabric. Kastking is beginning to become a go-to resource for my fishing and outdoor needs. Aside from one of my favorite baitcasting reels, I own a couple of pairs of their polarized sunglasses, a nice 20L dry bag with cell phone zip-lock holder, and now these awesome pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Fameli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fishing pliers...
customer_reviews.text: so far have owned one for nearly 2 weeks... have been tested it out while fishing here in Hawaii almost every day.. Needle Nose to pinch the tiny pieces, Different size holes to hold hooks securely while tightening knots.. I really like the cutting blade on the side of the pliers. Makes it a lot easier to cut/trim fishing line rather then trying to get it all the way down with regular needle nose. Also, my favorite part is the attached cord to keep it on me.. Iʻve lost a few pliers that were were just stuffed into pockets/straps on my Single Sling Tackle Bag.
customer_reviews.author: Edsel N. Ralar

customer_reviews.title: Solid, and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Pliers are underappreciated when fishing. Cheap ones tend to be loose which can be a real pain with certain tasks, such as split rings. You can spend an arm and a leg on high end pliers that will last a lifetime, but the people carrying those tend to either be professionals or have lots of disposable income. The rest of us have to look a bit harder to find the right balance of quality and price. I must say I was very surprised in the quality of these, especially at this price point. No slop in the movement and they do fine cutting.
customer_reviews.author: REV

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up in salt water
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use instead of a leather man I've used for 20 years. After a days fishing in the surf i rinse the leather man in fresh water and have no rust issues. Unfortunately i cannot say the same for this product. I am diligent about rinsing and soaking my equipment after saltwater fishing but this set of fishing pliers still showed signs of rust.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Only Downside is Carbide Blades Wear Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have dropped these in the water while Kayak fishing, no rust after and they have been on quite a few fishing trips. My only complaint is the carbide cutters get worn out from cutting braided line fairly quickly. I wish they had the same cutter type as the good cheap braid cutters here on Amazon. Seems like a fairly easy fix to make it perfect. Note - I was able to get them back because 1 - bright orange, 2 - holes in the handle allowed me to use a hook to pull them back up. I need to permanently attach them to the kayak via the included carabiner...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Made from 420 Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: 420 Stainless Steel contains a greater amount of chrome making it corrosive resistant and hard. This makes it ideal for the off-shore saltwater fishing I do 9 to 10 months a year. The split ring feature terminates in a point making it easier to open split rings as the boat rides the swells I often fish. The serrated finish on the griping portion of the pliers is very good and changes serration pattern at the point providing a sure grip when unhooking fish. The handles are comfortable on the hands and the extra long lanyard with sheath keeps it on your belt attached to you. Very well thought out tool for the fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: Go-Long

customer_reviews.title: Get the Split Ring Nose
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a couple weeks. I’ve already found all kinds of uses for it. Even outside of fishing. The split ring nose seems like a no-brainer to me. I don’t think any function is lost with this split ring nose and it certainly comes in handy in many more situations than I imagined. My wife broke her thumb nail away from her nailbed trying to move dog tags from one collar to the other and now she keeps raiding my fishing tackle to use these pliers! The tolerance is nice and tight. Happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Line clipper is dull already after a few weeks?
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these, I loved them. I used them at every chance possible. Now I have trouble cutting my braided line when it was easy peasy before. I notice their blades move a bit, so maybe it is an adjustment I need to make, but right now I have taken them off my wading belt and when back to my knife.... I know it is stupid to use pliers for the line cutting feature mainly, but it is soooo convenient... when it works.
customer_reviews.author: W1R3S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pliers with versatile ways to carry.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the pliers for 1 day of fishing so far but they seem excellent. I strapped the holster to my backpack for transport and then moved it to my belt when I was actually fishing. The pliers do not fall out of the holster easily and the strap makes sure if you drop it or it did fall out, that you do not lose them. Overall i would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Keller L

customer_reviews.title: Bad failing attachment belt clip for tool
customer_reviews.text: Great fishing tool. Quality craftsmanship, Highly pleases with its function ability. Top of the line, love it. That part which connects its casing to your belt though., It was so poorly constructed that it broke the first day I used it., I may have done something wrong but not enough that I even noticed other then the thing kept swiveling and would even turn upside down dumping the tool out. It’s heavy too. I gave it to a friend the expensive nice tool in a nice pouch ( no belt clip thing went in garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even close all the way...useless as a pair of pliers....lesson learned...other reviews mentioned this but I didn't listen
customer_reviews.author: E. Brooke Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing pliers, use the plier tooth as mini gaff, works well, DOESN'T PINCH FINGERS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Usually these multi tool fishing things are utter trash, this one is actually pretty good, line cutter works, belt hook is a bit deep (I usually fish in board shorts) and digs a bit if you don't have it exactly in the correct spot on your side. Only complaint is I wish the pliers were an inch or two longer, when larger fish swallow the hook you need to switch to a longer pliers, but for a mult-tool, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy Who Buys Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Good for cutting line, but....
customer_reviews.text: They look great and they cut braid great. Maybe for holding on to a hook, should work great. I prefer pliers that can grab and hold braid which these dont since they have a bigger gap the length of the plier. Deal breaker and wont order again. Really wanted to like them too.
customer_reviews.author: will caffrey

customer_reviews.title: These are great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought some cheap pliers on amazon, Plusinno brand. They no longer sell them but they were my favorite. I’ve bought 2 pairs of these Kast Kings, the black pair and the sea foam green. They are just like the plusinno pliers, little more expensive. But they are my favorite. I fish every weekend and sometimes during the week, fresh and saltwater. The sea foam green pliers have acquired some rust. But still operate fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Swoape

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these for a week but I love them. Easy to hold and use. The holster seems extremely durable. The teeth on the pliers don’t line up as other people have said but to me it seems intentional. In my opinion the offset teeth give a better grip to hooks. I tried these pliers on some tiny treble hooks I use for power bait (size 16 I think) and they have no problem gripping them. I also tested out the spit ring and I had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R. Brundage

customer_reviews.title: Feels Like Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using cheap needle-nose pliers since I started fishing last year. They work OK, but I've been eyeing something a little eaiser and fancier this spring. I just received these, and they really look and feel like a quality fishing tool. I also like the included leash and sheath, that will help keep them from going to the bottom of the lake. I'll update if things change once they're actually used, but right now I'd say they were a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brian From MN

customer_reviews.title: Katking has a new fan
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is very nice and much more than I was expecting, especially at the price. The grips are very nice in the hand and quite grippy. Should be very nice while wet. I am so impressed with these that I thought "if they put this much into pliers, I should try the spinning combo". Which I have and the Crixus is fantastic. Do not hesitate to purchase these pliers or the Crixus for that matter. Oh, the sheath is wonderful and comes with a clip for your pdf that you should always be wearing btw.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen DeWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Set of Pliers!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic set of pliers. They are very ergonomic and lightweight. They seem very high quality. Everything is placed well on the pliers, especially the fishing line cutters. You could easily spend much more on a set of fishing pliers and not get as many features. I love the split ring tool. I also love that they have holes to hold you fishing hook to allow you to tighten your knots easier. I have not had a chance to see how rust resistant they are yet, but will update the review over the next year. Overall for the price, I am very impressed with the quality and amount of features you receive with these fishing pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Green

customer_reviews.title: 1 year review
customer_reviews.text: Had these bad boys for a year now, still going strong, the snippet blades wore out, before I bought another pair I decided to reach out to the company and they instantly replied and send me out replacement blades, couldn’t be happier with my purchase knowing even after a year of my purchase the company still values me as a customer which is very rare, will be ordering another pair just because!
customer_reviews.author: Paul lore

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality - Much better than other aluminum body pliers I have seen for about the same price
customer_reviews.text: I am highly impressed with these fishing pliers. I really like the the body is made of stainless steel instead of aluminum. The grips are fantastic compared to pliers with just raw aluminum for the grip. The fit and finish was perfect and the alignment of the the plier head is spot on. The placement of the cutters is ideal and the blades on them are extremely sharp. Highly recommend the Kastking pliers and their fishing scissors are awesome too!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice little pliers and light as well. Lost a star because the little carabiner on the lanyard was broken when I unboxed them, and from the looks of it that piece wouldn't have lasted long even if it wasn't broken. It's a very low quality piece attached to some nice quality gear. These were nice enough pliers that I've got a set of the KastKing scissors on the way now.
customer_reviews.author: James Wood

customer_reviews.title: KastKing products are fantastic for us beginners
customer_reviews.text: You know when you're getting into a new hobby and you just don't know what you don't know? You've got the dollars set aside to spend, but what do you really need? Don't worry about it—KastKing thought of everything for you. These pliers are for so much more than hook retrieval: they have a split ring "tooth" to prevent one from breaking off their nails on opening split rings, another little tooth so you quit crimping your split shot with those beautiful teeth, and a variety of hook holes to help you tighten your knots. And they're kinda pretty. Thanks KastKing—I'm your new Queen.
customer_reviews.author: Mitsy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers, poor cutters
customer_reviews.text: Pliers feel great and do what they’re supposed to as far as removing hooks from fish. The cutters out of the box are great, cut braid and mono effortlessly. However, after only a couple weeks of owning them the cutters struggle to cut even the smallest mono and braid. They have worn down to the point of being unusable to trim even 20lb fluorocarbon. I’ve looked into replacing the cutters and it isn’t worth the cost. Will probably look at a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution of the case
customer_reviews.text: The pliers work as expected. However, the case is poorly designed. Don't these folks ever go and actually try out their own gear? If they did then, they would discover that the weight of the pliers causes the built-in swivel of the case to pivot far too easily causing the pliers to fall out of the case. This part was very disappointing. I will probably end up not using the case.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sorbo

customer_reviews.title: Cutters gave out quick.
customer_reviews.text: The pliers are pretty durable and rust resistant. I work as a charter boat captain. I have two issues with this product. The sheith that holds the pliers rotates about the center of gravity and is rarely in the vertical position when trying to put them back in. This causes a slight delay in accessing and replacing the tool. May not be a big deal for most, but when using over 100 daily it's pretty annoying (I modified the case holder stay in place). The line cutters gave us pretty quick and now almost useless. I've had these only a couple of months and have to find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Nowicki

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing pliers!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of fishing pliers. The side clippers make cutting line a lot easier than the standard channel style. They produce a satisfying 'snip' sound. I have not tried them on braid yet, but they seem up to the job. One plus is the sheath, it has a really nice clip system that is rotatable. I am using these when I wade, so having something that has a sheath and a clip-on stretch line helps me not lose a them (as I seem to do every year). Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Synchronize Your Dogmas

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Received these fishing pliers for my birthday. No more struggling to remove hooks that the fish have swallowed. These help remove it without injuring the fish so I can release them on the days I’m just fishing for fun and not dinner!! Plus I love the belt holster and attached D-ring and cord. Now I know I won’t drop them in the lake. Highly recommend these to any fisherman/woman!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking tool
customer_reviews.text: Only used on a couple trips so far. Looks well made and durable. Time will tell. Made of anodized aluminum, these won't rust like my last pair of needlenose. Grips feel secure even in rain with fish slime on hands. Holder is functional and well designed. I could see the size of the grip being too large for some. Was comfortable for me with my larger than average hands, but awkward for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: ArtM

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pliers I've owned!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers, handles and jaws are 1 piece very sturdy, torsionally too , unlike most on Amazon. Main reason I bought these was for the braid cutter because most pliers have a gap where line hides from cutters so you have to hold line and pliers just right to cut, these work way better. Cuts right thru 50# power pro. 2 improvements I would make: 1. Reduce length from 7-3/8" to 6.9999" so it can go in airplane carry-on bag. (TSA 7" max) 2. Add spot to wrap braid for tightening knots without cutting into handle.
customer_reviews.author: trevor n.

customer_reviews.title: Will RUST in Saltwater after 1st USE!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE writing bad reviews. I never give 1 star because I’m not a d***. But I must say I used this 1 time in Tampa bay and yes I could have cleaned it better after the first use. But this much rust is unacceptable. And on top of that I thought stainless steal didn’t rust ?????? I had to give it 3 stars because somethings not right with this... Other then that yea it was a GREAT before the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Kobe Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: I take these kayak fishing and they are great. I have the pair with the split ring splitter at the end and it works great for changing hooks on lures. The pliers work great as pliers and for cutting line. I love the ergonomic grips and the sheath that they come with. Highly recommend these. I've purchased cheaper ones but they just dont last or perform like these do.
customer_reviews.author: KSD

customer_reviews.title: Everything they are meant to be and more!
customer_reviews.text: These fishing pliers have all of the functions detailed and they work great. They are durable, very very strong, and are really accessible when paired with a KastKing tackle bag. One thing that stands out aside from the strenght these pliers have is the coiled attachment cord. I snap this on the front of my tackle bag and they can be easily retrieved if they slip out of my hands. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Garcia

customer_reviews.title: All in one
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of pliers. The cutting tool is amazing. This is my third set. Now I have 3 on the boat. I got rid of all the others. I keep one on my hip, 1 in the front and one in the back of the boat. This does it all. Cut braid, pulls the line tight and gets the hook out of the fish. I just rinse salt water off after each trip with the fresh water hose.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3 weeks after return window closed
customer_reviews.text: After reading great reviews about these pliers ,I bought them. They worked about three weeks before breaking. I wrote a negative review about the product and figured I would have to buy a new pair from another company. The people at Kastking were very understanding and offered to send a new pair. Hopefully the next pair will be better. The response from Kastking was very professional and I wont hesitate to buy their products in the future based on the way they stand behind them.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is extremely well made, the build quality is superb. As with other Kastking products you can tell that it was designed by folks that fish. I was a bit skeptical about the line cutter on these, and the first time I tried them I thought they didn’t work because I couldn’t feel the line cut. They were actually so sharp and well aligned that the cut is almost imperceptible. I also appreciate the “Oh !#%#+!” I dropped them overboard lanyard, great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I used them once. They started to rust almost immediately and when crimping some small #1 sleeves for my next fishing trip, they snapped. The “cutouts” in the handle reduces weight but it’s a weak point. Not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after first use
customer_reviews.text: Description says anti corrosive. But they completely rusted over after the first use of fishing. And I made sure to rinse them with fresh water and throughly dry.
customer_reviews.author: Nick sarna

customer_reviews.title: keeps sliding out and doesn't stay close
customer_reviews.text: these are simple pliers, nothing really special about them. Cutter struggles with 50lb braid quite a bit and more or less useless to remove small hooks from fish. I honestly expected more from this product, it does have a retainer, so when it slips out again, at least it's not lost to the water, which I guess it's a plus
customer_reviews.author: berlinguyinca

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than others
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality and feel of these pliers. The design of the sheath is much better than other pliers of the same type. When the pliers are inside the sheath, it is held in place by the spring tension of the pliers. You don't have to use velcro to secure it or to remove it. I would pay a few more dollars just for that design along. Glad I chose the Kastking pliers over other generic brands because Kastking actually try to produce quality stuffs.
customer_reviews.author: Eyu

customer_reviews.title: Don't Shut All The Way.  Defective.
customer_reviews.text: The pliers do not close all the way shut. There is a gap in the jaws, even at the tip. This makes them useless as pliers! The black plastic on the handle is defective. Low quality everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Look4Deals

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Too lazy to take pictures but these pliers are worth every cent of 25$. The line cutters came in handy more times than I could count, having them being able to go in my pocket or dangle outside my tackle bag made life very easy also. Have had them for well over a year now and only use them for saltwater fishing never clean them off or anything and they are still 100% functional everything works and the cutters cut. Some surface rust but that’s what happens when you don’t clean things. 10/10 product
customer_reviews.author: stephen wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice but one fixable holster flaw
customer_reviews.text: The pliers are nice, the lanyard is the correct length, the holster is perfect, and the price is fair. The problem is the holster belt clip spins around and the detents don’t hold it in place so the pliers rotate around and fall out while you move around fishing. I fixed it by flooding the two rotating parts with super glue to hold it in a fixed position. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool for any level angler.
customer_reviews.text: This tool or really tools, is a total must have for any fisherman. Pretty much everything you need from prying out hooks, splitting hard to split split rings, and snipping line this one great tool does it all. I ABSOLUTELY love mine, and thankfully the included lanyard and D-Ring saved me from dropping them in the lake twice already. Worth every freaking penny. KastKing has never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly awesome due to the split ring feature
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these with the split ring nose and discovered they are great for breaking knots in smaller ropes ( like paracord). This is because the little tip that spreads rings grabs the rope and lets you loosen the knot apart without having to squeeze the plyers really tight to hold on to the rope, which can damage it. The finish and smooth action are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: David J Grab

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pliers after I lost my cheap $5 ones over the side of my kayak that I bought from Walmart. I wanted a new pair with a lanyard or storage case that I could secure to my kayak and this had both! It feels well made and the extra functions it has is very useful. The line cutter alone means I don't need to use my scissors anymore. I think Kastking is now one of my new favourite budget fishing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kiz

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but not really meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Not really ergonomic design. Hard to hold and it hurts my finger when clamping. The wirecutter got wear out quickly after couple time of usage and no longer sharp enough to cut the lines. I think i will need a buy dremel tool to sharpen it. The plier holder not holds very well and it turns upside down all the time when clipping it to my belt.
customer_reviews.author: picpop

customer_reviews.title: Buying another pair
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome pliers! They fit in your hand well, they open and close very smoothly, and as long as you have the littles holster thing that comes with it attached to your belt and the clip attached to it, you can't accidentally throw them overboard instead of the fish. They seem to be very well built. I really like the orange grip on the handles, nice and easy to see. I will be interested to see if their other products are just as nice. I highly recommend buying these pliers. I will be buying another set for my ice fishing box
customer_reviews.author: Brian Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with all the features you need in a pair of fishing pliers all packaged in a very high quality build. The carbide cutters go through braid like butter without fraying the line, handles are comfortable, split ring tip is sharp and effective, case is well constructed and comes with a tether so you don't lose them.. Overall incredibly solid pair of pliers for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Haubert

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a week of use
customer_reviews.text: Liked the price so I tried them out for a fishing trip. They do not have a latch to stay closed so if they are not in the holder. Just as I worried about the quality of all the Kastking products they broke after 1 week of use. After these and a Bassinator I returned for poor quality I will avoid trusting all the positive reviews for this company, I really wanted to like them but they need to budget some of the advertising money into quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Since I moved to the coast I have been replacing out all my freshwater fishing gear. I didn't realize how fast stuff rusts with the salt water. I purchased these because my old fishing pliers... aren't functional anymore after 1 trip (rinsing them off wasn't enough). I couldn't be happier with these! they cut line super well, pliers grip is good and they clip onto my PFD so i can always keep them handy. If i needed them again i would purchase for sure but I get the feeling i'll be using these for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Lee Baker

customer_reviews.title: Finally a set of pliers that will last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pliers to replace a set I previously purchased on Amazon. You know the ones with the separate clamping jaws. Well the idea to allow the replacement of those jaws is nice but the functionality is not good. Rather than buy another identical set to have them fail again, I searched for a better style, these are the answer. Nice feel in the hands, one piece design, sturdy case, nice color (seafoam). Overall a solid investment. Thanks, KastKing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have smooth spring action, will have to see how it holds up over time when getting wet. Spring could be a little stronger but again as long as it holds up its fine. Will be using mainly for freshwater. Fishing line cutter is conveniently located and holes for hook insert to secure hook to safely tie knots to convenient and fits slightly larger hooks, good for the lake fishing I will be using it for. Seems like good product for the price you pay and the carrying case is convenient. 3/5 for overall quality but for the price I’d give it 4.5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hi VIS Orange easy to find
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my old rusty needle nose pliers. I have become a fan of Kastking. I have 2 of their bait caster reels. An these pliers do not disappoint. I have only used them a couple of times so far. Haven't experienced any problems. I would suggest these. For 20 bucks how can you go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey C.

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of fishing pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pliers mainly to keep in our boat. We had a cheap pair that are big & bulky, and it was impossible to get hooks out of sunfish with them. The Kastking cutthroat's design is much more ergonomic than my crappy pliers and the nose is thin enough to fit in the fishes mouth. The best part of the Kastking cutthroat pliers is the little lip on the end of the pliers... this really makes it easy to get those difficult hooks out! They are very sturdy & they have a lanyard. Definitely going to buy another pair for my dad who loves to fish!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Same But Yet Different
customer_reviews.text: KastKing has done it again with their Cutthroat Fishing Pliers. They have taken a common design that is inexpensive and made it better. To my surprise the grip is a hard rubber meaning that in wet, cold conditions these pliers work great. Who has time to clean your hands when you need pliers in a hurry. I have a young boy I am teaching to fish so fishing from the bank is a problem. My hands are usually covered in slime, holding the fish, avoiding tree branches, layered in live bait guts...you get the point. These are one hand operational and tethered to your body however needed. Spring loaded, split ring tip and always attached. Most important accessory when fishing!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Let's get the bad news out of the way first: The carabiner clip that comes with these pliers is underwhelming. It's dinky and feels like it'll break fairly easily. Ok, that's it for the negative. Everything else is great. I bought these pliers because of the line cutter. It looks like it's in a weird spot, but it's SO much easier to position and use than the traditional back-of-the-jaws location. I didn't think the split-ring beak was going to be that useful... that lasted until I had to change the treble hook on a dive bait. I'm sold on the idea now. As for the rest of the features, it's everything I would expect from a quality set of pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Tight hold, bold color, and great snips
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed the pliers so far this season. They're easy to grip and function as they should. The small clippers that come with the pliers cut through braid and mono just fine. The bright colored handle also makes it easy for me to find the pliers when I put them on the ground or iny tackle bag.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! I use these alot every time I go fishing. The line cutter is really helpful so I don't have to grab my knife while setting up my rig just use the tool I already have in hand. I love the grips on the pliers, no slip even when wet and the bunge is a nice plus. Over great pliers I use every time out and expect to last year's.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: These pliars are what a fisherman really need.
customer_reviews.text: Execellent pliars real nice quality works on braid line holds it really good cuts any size easy grabs hooks at any angle will buy again and tell friends and family to buy thanks k. K. For the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design Makes For A Versatile Tool
customer_reviews.text: Likes : Quick release from adjustable belt clip holster; Handles grips well with wet or dry hands; Lanyard is plastic coated coiled steel with carabiner hook buckle for added anti-drop security; Handy line cutter and Ribbed plier jaws grip and hold tight all the way to the tip end Dislikes : This tool is adequate for mouth hook extraction but lacks the reach for deep hook extraction.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Fishing Pliers
customer_reviews.text: It's good fishing pliers for the price. It's great to be prepared when fishing. Not only for hooks, but also for controlling swivels and other precise requirements for action. Without rust, it’s also nice, as it will happen to any non-target pair of pliers that you throw in the gear box.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These are a nice set of fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: At first, I wasn't sure I liked not having a lock to keep these pliers closed. I soon realized it wasn't necessary and would be more trouble than it was worth. They function well. I used them to remove a hook deep in a mouth of a halibut and also used them for a split ring. No problems at all. I exposed them to saltwater and it still looks good. I actually want another pair. One for the boat and one for my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold and easy to use. I mostly do saltwater fishing and other pliers have rusted easily, these seem to be much better quality and less likely to rust over time. I do like the placement of the line cutter, very convenient compared to others. A bonus is that they match my bag and other gear.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great Fishing Pliers
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality and look of this plier, it's a lightweight and has a nice case. I have only used it a few times and I am happy with grip and feel of this product so far and use it for fishing. I also purchased the 7 in. filet knife and have been happy with this product as well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect plier pairing with the KastKing Fishing Tackle Bags
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect pliers to pair with the KastKing Fishing Tackle Bags (I got the Lunker, but also the Hawg and smaller Hoss). They fit perfectly in the outside holder and are beefy enough that you feel like you can get a really good grip. They are well made and look great. I got orange to match my bag color and the lanyard connects right to the bag. I've already used them successfully ocean fishing, they replace a cheaper pair of pliers that I had previously purchased. Really, all the KastKing gear is top notch from what I can tell (and I've purchased the Lunker Bag and the 3600 and 3700 boxes as well as braided line).
customer_reviews.author: Garrett B.

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with ergonomics, sturdy built. Love side cutter for tag ends without going through center of pliers. These should last with normal use ,I take care of my fishing equipment and treat whatever it is with correct technique. any thing used outside its ability will fail. Use it the correct way should have no problem. Very satisfied with product.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers but cutters are not good
customer_reviews.text: Have been really impressed with the quality of cascade products so far I have suppliers as well as the scale and they have both been great. The only issue I have had with these pliers is that the cutters are not very sharp and are basically worthless except for cutting some mono
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out tool!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new pair of fishing pliers and am very pleased with these Kastking Cutthroat pliers. They are easy to hold and work and are a well thought out design that will help with hook removal and line prep. They are well made and should hold up to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Goose Slayer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fishing Pliers
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my fishing tacklebox. Before I purchased this, I bought a cheap fishing pliers at Walmart and they rusted on the first use. The quality of the materials on this is great! I also like the fact that it comes with a sheath and a lanyard. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and sharp cutter
customer_reviews.text: Been using these pliers for a bit now inshore and coastal in SoCal and they work killer. Just got back from Catalina where we got some nice yellows. Only downs side is that they work great for lighter split rings , but not for heavier gauge stuff but I have dedicated split ring pliers for that. You ever need someone to test your gear in so cal on some big boys let me know! So far everything I’ve used from these guys has performed way above the price point
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Quality made
customer_reviews.text: One of the best fishing pliers I ever owned for the price and quality and I have had a few... Metal all the way through, side cutters in outer position for close cuts, cuts braid like butter, comes with case and lanyard, split ring tool, and compact.. What else you want? automatic? Oh it was even greased at the moving pivot joints...
customer_reviews.author: SoloMio

customer_reviews.title: Sheath turns upside down constantly
customer_reviews.text: THe belt sheath is not a fixed point, its on a swivel. It was constantly turning upside down. Would not buy this unless you want to keep searching for your tool. Sometimes fell out of sheath, so using the caribiner is a must. Tool itselt was great, but sheath is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Gdog in DE

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and function.
customer_reviews.text: First, great packaging. When u receive a new package and it’s nicely packaged it gives u confidence you’ve bought a great product. So far, they work great for what I bought them for, switching out hooks on my plugs, poppers, crank baits and such. Have used the line cutters a few times already. Very sharp. As I spend more time on saltwater I’ll be able to really see what they got. Definitely look and feel nice.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Sheath clip is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Just got them today, feel good out of the box, my only complaint which to me is pretty important is the sheath clip, it swivels way to easily and winds up upside down, the pliers stay in place if you are standing still, but if you were walking a trail, or even just moving about they will fall out, big con for me, I am sure I can find an easy solution, but I shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Mk2gti1

customer_reviews.title: Great set of fishing pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Pliers are excellent, although just a tad bit heavy which is fine trade-off for durability. The pliers also come with grooves to let you easily tighten your knots without the potential hazard of hooking yourself or adding unnecessary wear and tear on your hands or gloves. Sheath is also great as it is shaped to the pliers and also has 2 holes for both left and right side on your belt. The sheath's belt clip also "snaps" into position every 45 degrees if you feel the need to reposition the pliers on your belt. Will have to see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Chang Oh Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are top of the line fishing pliers. I can’t say enough good things about these. The line cutters are so conveniently placed so it makes cutting line simple. The pliers work well for anything. I keep these pliers clipped to my shorts with the included cord. Great buy for fishermen.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pliers I've owned
customer_reviews.text: These pliers have a comfortable grip, spring loaded action and the cutters on the side cut through 20 lb. braided line with ease. The pliers are slim and have a good grip. If there was one thing I would suggest as an improvement is maybe just an 1/8" wider jaws. You won't be disappointed in these, solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multifunctional tool that will eliminate the need to bring additional tools while fishing. The pliers come with a lanyard and sheath eliminating the need to make additional purchases to make the pliers usable. When i fish i like to eliminate as much as possible so i can concentrate on catching fish and not having to run to my tackle box to hunt for the appropriate tool. The kicker is that this tool when on your belt will look so cool! These pliers feel solid and well constructed of quality materials. i can't wait to bring them on my next fishing trip
customer_reviews.author: Roland Ferrer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: For less than $20, I wasn't expecting such high quality. These pliers have all the bells and whistles, from a textured and super grippy handle, to the razor sharp line cutters, this tool is very well thought out. Long term durability remains to be seen but these things feel SO solid, I'm not too concerned!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and needed
customer_reviews.text: These pliers do not disappoint in any way. Day one I tested the braid cutters and they are amazingly sharp and will cut through any size or weight of line, short of crazy large boat lines. The holster is solid and I was able to clip it comfortably onto the shoulder strap of my kayak PFD. The only thing I would say about these to someone thinking about getting a pair is that the teeth dont mesh like what you find in your tool box so if you grab your line almost exactly perpendicular to the nose it my slip through. And to KastKing, I'd really like to see a stainless/orange pair in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Tallent

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy that I got these pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pliers for when I go out fishing and when I am at home setting up my rigs. I love the part of the pliers where I cut my fishing line, its in such a convenient location. The clip that is on the holster holds tight on my shorts. The lanyard is of a durable plastic material that I like. I have been searching for a solid pair of pliers both at Walmart and Amazon and these are the best that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE

product_meta.title: KastKing Cutthroat 7” Fishing Pliers, 420 Stainless Steel Fishing Tools, Saltwater Resistant Fishing Gear, Tungsten Carbide Cutters, Corrosion Resistant Teflon Coating, Rubber Handle
feature_bullets: Corrosion Resistant Stainless Steel – The KastKing Cutthroat pliers are made from corrosion resistant 420 stainless steel and coated with a tough Teflon coating for added protection. Our stainless steel pliers are 46% harder than aluminum pliers and nearly 3 times the bending strength of aluminum pliers. Designed for long term performance, these pliers are ideal for both freshwater and harsh saltwater environments.

Tungsten Carbide Cutters – Super hard tungsten carbide cutters slice though mono, fluorocarbon, or braid with ease. Side mounted anvil cutters for easy access, these cutters allow you to cut your tag end as close to the knot as you desire without any obstructions and the raised surface behind the blade ensures your line will always be in the cutting zone.

Multi-Function Jaws – Grab and remove any fish hook with the serrated jaws or take advantage of the crimping slots to secure a split shot weight or build a steel leader. To cinch down a knot quickly and safely, insert your hook into one of the holes in the jaws and pull on your hook to create a tight knot. Available in both a straight nose and a Split ring nose design.

Rubber Handle – The ergonomic textured rubber handle provides comfort and control. A thin grip profile and the spring loaded jaws allow for easy one hand use without worrying about the pliers slipping out of your hands.

Sheath/Lanyard Included – Includes a custom molded sheath with belt clip to ensure your investment is protected from normal wear and tear. Clip on to your belt or the waistband of your shorts, to make sure you have quick access when a fish is on the line and the coiled lanyard will ensure your pliers don’t fall overboard!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
